fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Competition, International co-operation and development, Employment and Social Affairs, Trans-European Networks, Transport
eu_initiatives: IDC is the only organisation capable of bringing together the different port dockworker groups and unions with a single voice on an regional (EU) and international scale.  Dockworkers can discuss regional issues and initiatives (ex. new legislation in Ports)  with the EU in an effort to both form new ideas through constructive dialogue and as an interlocutor between national governments and international decision-making forums.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
Meeting with Commissioner Violeta Bulc 
Sectorial Social Dialogue on Ports (EC)
goals__remit: The International Dockworkers Council (IDC) is an international nonprofit association formed by 90 organizations from 41 countries, with over 100,000 affiliated members. Our mission is to uphold labor standards that will improve the economic and social well-being of port workers around the world. IDC serves as an interlocutor to form fair and sustainable policies, and to promote best practices across the maritime industry.
